unnormalised: On the eve of August 15th, 1947, at precisely 11:59 PM, India officially declared its independence. The air crackled with anticipation as the clock ticked towards midnight, marking the end of nearly two centuries of British rule. Jawaharlal Nehru, in his now-iconic "Tryst with Destiny" speech, addressed the nation from the Parliament, painting a vision of a free and prosperous India.
